name: Moroccan Tripe
ingredients: 700g of sheep tripe (kercha/douara) or beef tripe
10 cl of tomato purée (or 1 peeled tomato, diced)
1 handful of olives (for the end of cooking)
Finely chopped coriander and parsley (unspecified quantity)
Spices: 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp turmeric, salt, pepper, 1 pinch of sweet paprika (or Espelette pepper)
steps: Clean and cut the tripe into small pieces (Boil them whole for 10 minutes beforehand to remove impurities, then cut). Rub with salt and rinse several times. Drain.
Place the tripe in a pot or tajine. Add the oil. Cook for about 10 minutes while stirring.
Add the onion, crushed garlic, and chopped coriander/parsley. Let cook for about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato purée (or fresh tomato), the pulp of the preserved lemon, and the tomato paste. Season with salt, pepper, cumin, turmeric, and paprika.
Add the soaked chickpeas. Cover with water. Let cook on low heat for about 1 hour and 15 minutes (the cooking time should be long to make the tripe tender). Keep an eye on the broth.
After 1 hour and 15 minutes, add the olives and the remaining preserved lemon, chopped. Extend the cooking for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with fresh coriander/parsley. Serve hot.
